Cleaning up history db, deleting records before timestamp: %s. Cleaning up spam db, deleting %s records before timestamp: %s". Resolved url: %s Time cost: %s milliseconds. Parsed %s rules. Adding %s numbers to spam db. Number list is empty, nothing to import. Importing %s numbers as regex rule. Creating rule with %s numbers. Replacing the rule with description: %s. Rule with description %s not found. Merging the rule with description: %s. Regex count before: %s, after: %s. Replacing number from %s to %s. Found %s rules with description %s. Modifying %s rules. The number %s doesn\'t match the filter %s, skip. Failed to detect country code. Identified as spam number, category: %s. Identified as valid number, category: %s. Unidentified number. Auto detect country code requires permission READ_PHONE_STATE. Supported tags:

- {cc}
  The country code.
- {domestic}
  The domestic part.
- {number}
  The full number, including both country code and domestic part, without leading + or 0s.
- {origin_number}
  The origin number that can contain leading + or 0s.

- {year}
  The year, e.g.: 2024
- {month} {day}
  Single-digit number will be padded with leading zero, e.g.:
  {month}_{day} -> 01_02
- {month_index} {day_index}
  These values will be padded without leading zero, e.g.:
  {month}_{day} -> 1_2
PhoneBlock ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª Currently, it\'s for German users, with potential for global expansion.
Website: https://phoneblock.net Register an account on https://phoneblock.net to get your username and password. Then, fill them in below.

They should look like:
- username:
  xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
- password:
  xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx The call screening time limit is 5 seconds, with a %s ms buffer for the inaccuracy of time functions, the total time limit is actually %s ms. The previous steps cost %s ms, not enough time left, skip. Filter Query Result Generate a list of numbers that contains all spam numbers that were identified in the previous step. Another thread is cancelled.> username> password> Swipe left to delete it.

Most card-like UI elements in this app are associated with swiping gestures, some of which also support swiping right, for example, the history records. >
